avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in the mountains after SW-snow showers and strong winds. Significant, ongoing snow showers over the weekend further encourage wind slab and cornice formation on N- and E- aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Warming and rain on Wednesday and Thursday caused most of the snow in lower elevations to melt and little snow was left in the mountains. Thursday afternoon, temperatures cooled with snow showers and snow covers the region again. Since, wind slabs have likely formed again on N- and E-aspects and can be expected to continue forming with ongoing snowfall over the weekend.  Little snow is underneath the new snow and people traveling in the mountains should be careful of rocks underneath the wind slab.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðvestan og sunnan 8-15 og él á föstudag. Áframhaldandi SV-éljagangur yfir helgina og hvessir á sunnudagskvöld.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avalanches, most of them small, released in the area during and after heavy but short snowfall and snowdrift on early Thursday 25 January.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh layered snow is in mountains, with thin wind slabs that can be unstable. Several small avalanches released in the area after intense but short snowfall and snowdrift on Thursday morning. Snow showers are forecasted the next few days in southerly winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During the last week, snow has added and drifted in various wind directions. Before, there was very little snow. The night before Thursday, it snowed heavily for a while, first in NE directions, then in E and SW directions. As a result, many small avalanches released in the forecast area, on slopes facing various directions. The snowpack is now layered, and thin unstable wind slabs can have formed in various aspects. In the next few days, snow showers in SW and variable southerly winds are forecasted. Further wind slabs are expected to build up, especially on NW-E facing slopes.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Dálítill éljagangur næstu daga í SV og breytilegum suðlægum áttum. Minni úrkoma á sunnudag. Hlýnar ögn og hvessir seinnipart mánudags og þá gæti rignt eða slyddað um tíma, kólnar svo aftur.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches have been releasing in the region on various aspects. During the thaw on Thursday, a small avalanche released close to the Siglufjarðarvegur road by Landsendi. Last week, avalanches were reported on Hrafnabjargarhnjúkur in Karlsárdalur and four in Bustarbrekkudalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Strong SW-snow showers in the next days will continue forming wind slabs on N-E facing aspects, mostly in south part of the region. Warming and thawing earlier this week has strengthened the snow pack up to 1000 m. Weak layers may still be present above.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Significant warming and thaw on Wednesday and Thursday has penetrated and strengthened the snowpack. All snow measurement stations show a uniform, isothermic snowpack under 1000 m but weakness may still be present in the snowpack above. However, it is likely to have strengthened in all elevations during this warming and subsequent freezing. SW snowfall is expected throughout the weekend in high winds in the mountains that could form windslabs and cornices on N and E facing hills.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Yfir helgina má búast við hvassri SV-átt og lítilsháttar éljagangi suðvestantil á svæðinu.

avalancheActivity.comment: A small wet sluff released above Neskaupstaður in the thaw on Thursday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has mostly become homogeneous and isothermal after the thaw on Thursday, but layers may still be present in the highest mountains where the thaw had less effect. New snow that adds on top can be unstable and new thin slabs may form in SW snowdrift.

snowpackStructure.highlights: In warm weather and rain on Thursday, snow subsided and became homogeneous and isothermal up to high elevations. Temperatures went over 0°C for a time, up to ca 1000 m elevation. In the highest mountains, old weaknesses may still exist. Since Thursday, a bit more snow has added and the next few days some more should fall and drift in SW or variable southerly winds. New thin wind slabs are expected to form where snow accumulates, especially in NW-E aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: SV- og breytilegar suðlægar áttir næstu daga, allhvassar á köflum. Lítilsháttar éljagangur, einkum sunnan til á spásvæðinu.
